bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Albemarle County was formed in 1744 from Goochland County. Parts of Louisa County were added in 1761 and 1838.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Order book, 1791-1793, of Albemarle County Court that records all matters brought before the court when it was in session. It provides a synopses of cases in a neater, more organized form. These volumes are sometimes internally indexed; more rarely, there is a comprehensive index. A wide variety of information is found in this order book including: deeds, chancery causes, judgments, records of legal disputes heard before the county court and road orders. This order book contains an index.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Albemarle County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional Albemarle County Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localities Database found at the Library of Virginia web site.
